body:
I'm trying to find out which exception occurred from the middleware. 

Let's say I have something like this:

```ruby
class ExceptionDetector
   def initialize(app)
     @app = app
   end

   def call(env)
      response = @app.call(env)
      if env["action_dispatch.exception"] # or whatever else
        puts "exception occurred"
      end
      response
   end
end
```

And my middleware stack looks like
```ruby

use ExceptionDetector
use ActionDispatch::ShowExceptions
use ActionDispatch::DebugExceptions
run Testola::Application.routes
```


Is there a better way to achieve this? Should I just add the rescue block inside my middleware and place it after exception middleware? Like this:

```ruby
class ExceptionDetector
   def initialize(app)
      @app = app
   end

   def call(env)
      begin
        response = @app.call(env)
      rescue => exception
        puts "exception occurred"
        raise exception
      end
      response
   end
end

# stack:

use ActionDispatch::ShowExceptions
use ActionDispatch::DebugExceptions
use ExceptionDetector
run Testola::Application.routes

```

Thanks!
